agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
taxonomy_name: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions
nameLevel4: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions

agency_name: INDIANA FAMILY AND SOCIAL SERVICES ADMINISTRATION - LONG-TERM CARE OMBUDSMAN PROGRAM
agency_desc: A division of the Indiana Family and Social Services Administration that advocates for residents of Indiana long-term care facilities, which includes nursing facilities and licensed assisted living facilities, to promote and protect resident rights guaranteed under federal and state law.
service_description: Receives, investigates, and attempts to resolve problems or complaints involving residents of long-term care facilities (nursing facilities, residential care facilities, assisted-living facilities, adult foster care homes, and county residential care facilities) located in Dearborn, Jefferson, Ohio, Ripley, and Switzerland County.
site_details: Call for information, advocacy, referrals, or to make a complaint.
site_eligibility: Persons with questions or complaints about long-term care facilities located in Dearborn, Jefferson, Ohio, Ripley, or Switzerland County

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization providing a range of mental health and addiction treatment services for Franklin, Ohio, Ripley, and Switzerland County.
service_description: Offers outpatient treatment for adults and youth experiencing a mental health issue or psychiatric disorder, such as anger management, anxiety, attention deficit-hyperactivity disorder, bi-polar disorder, depression, post-traumatic stress disorder, or schizophrenia. Services include an initial assessment as well as individual, group, and/or family counseling. Case management, psychiatric medication services, home-based services, community-based psychiatric rehabilitation, supported employment services, and residential programs are available to eligible clients receiving treatment from this center.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call the office for an initial assessment.

site_schedule.name: Outpatient Mental Health Facilities
site_schedule.schedule: Mon, Wed, and Thurs 8am-6pm; Tues 8am-7pm; Fri 8am-noon -- Crisis Services: Daily 24 hours

site_schedule.name: General Counseling Services
site_schedule.schedule: Mon, Wed, and Thurs 8am-6pm; Tues 8am-7pm; Fri 8am-noon -- Crisis Services: Daily 24 hours

site_schedule.name: Adolescent/Youth Counseling
site_schedule.schedule: Mon, Wed, and Thurs 8am-6pm; Tues 8am-7pm; Fri 8am-noon -- Crisis Services: Daily 24 hours

site_schedule.name: Psychiatric Disorder Counseling
site_schedule.schedule: Mon, Wed, and Thurs 8am-6pm; Tues 8am-7pm; Fri 8am-noon -- Crisis Services: Daily 24 hours

site_schedule.name: Mental Health Evaluation
site_schedule.schedule: Mon, Wed, and Thurs 8am-6pm; Tues 8am-7pm; Fri 8am-noon -- Crisis Services: Daily 24 hours

site_schedule.name: Substance Use Disorder Counseling
site_schedule.schedule: Mon, Wed, and Thurs 8am-6pm; Tues 8am-7pm; Fri 8am-noon -- Crisis Line: Daily 24 hours

site_eligibility: Open
Living in Dearborn, Franklin, Ohio, Ripley, or Switzerland County

agency_desc: County veterans service officers are veterans employed by the county to act as liaisons with county residents for veteran issues, including but not limited to; providing forms, information, and assistance in obtaining state and federal veterans benefits.
service_description: Provides information about and assistance with veterans' benefits to veterans, their surviving spouses, and their children. County service officers can assist in the completion and submission of forms necessary to receive all appropriate federal and state veterans' benefits.
site_details: Call to make an appointment.
site_eligibility: Veteran, surviving spouses or children of a veteran

agency_desc: A government agency offering recycling services.
site_name: SOUTHEASTERN INDIANA RECYCLING DISTRICT - SWITZERLAND COUNTY
service_description: Provides a drop-off center for recycling paper, cardboard, newspapers, magazines, plastic bottles and jugs (#1-#2), glass, and aluminum/steel cans. This site also has a reuse center where donations of working equipment/tools, household appliances and goods, clothing, books, toys, and other items are offered to anyone at no charge.
site_details: Call or visit the website for information. -- Walk in to drop off approved recyclables. -- Walk in to browse available items in reuse center; take whatever is needed.

site_schedule.name: General Appliance Provision
site_schedule.schedule: Recycling and Reuse: Mon and Wed noon-6pm; Sat 8am-noon

site_schedule.name: Kitchenware
site_schedule.schedule: Recycling and Reuse: Mon and Wed noon-6pm; Sat 8am-noon

site_schedule.name: General Clothing Provision
site_schedule.schedule: Recycling and Reuse: Mon and Wed noon-6pm; Sat 8am-noon

site_schedule.name: Tools/Equipment
site_schedule.schedule: Recycling and Reuse: Mon and Wed noon-6pm; Sat 8am-noon

site_schedule.name: Recycling Centers
site_schedule.schedule: Recycling and Reuse: Mon and Wed noon-6pm; Sat 8am-noon

site_eligibility: Open; serves Switzerland County

agency_desc: A county healthcare clinic managed by nurse practitioners located in Switzerland County.
service_description: Provides preventive health services and treatment for people who have minor ailments such as ear and eye infections, strep throat, allergies, bladder infections or flu. They also administer vaccines and perform routine screenings. Care is provided by Nurse Practitioners.
site_details: Call for information or to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency that partners with local human service organizations, businesses, and government agencies to support and strengthen the community.
service_description: Works to improve quality of life by promoting charitable giving, connecting donors to the critical needs of the community, and evaluating and addressing community issues.
site_details: Call or visit website for more information. -- (Persons seeking assistance from one of the programs funded are directed to call 2-1-1.)
site_eligibility: Provides financial support to area non-profits that support community needs.

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement services and maintains the correctional facility for Switzerland County.
service_description: Provides law enforcement, crime prevention, and criminal investigation services and administers county correctional facilitiesIn Switzerland County. Operates a 24-hour dispatch service for police officers, firefighters, and medics. A ten-digit dispatch number is provided for nonemergency dispatch calls. For emergency assistance, persons should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency police, fire, or medical assistance. For nonemergency requests or reports, call the office during normal business hours. nonemergency dispatch number.
site_eligibility: Open; serves Switzerland County
To visit: Must be on the inmate's approved visitor list -- Age 18 or older (or accompanied by someone over 18 who is also on the inmate's visitor list)

agency_name: SOUTHEASTERN INDIANA INDEPENDENT LIVING CENTER INC
agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that promotes and practices the philosophy of independent living and educates individuals with significant disabilities how they can better help themselves.
site_name: SOUTHEASTERN INDIANA INDEPENDENT LIVING CENTER INC
service_description: Assisting individuals in their efforts to learn new ways to perform daily living functions such as: cooking, bill paying, cleaning, shopping, dressing, and many others.
taxonomy_name: Protection and Advocacy for Individuals With Disabilities
nameLevel4: Protection and Advocacy for Individuals With Disabilities
site_details: Call to make appointment.

site_schedule.name: Protection and Advocacy for Individuals With Disabilities

site_eligibility: Open; must have mental or physical disability
Open

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties for the town of Vevay in Switzerland County.
service_description: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties for the town of Vevay in Switzerland County. Persons in need of emergency police assistance should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency assistance. For nonemergency services, call the office during business hours or call Switzerland County dispatch after hours.
site_eligibility: Open; serves the town of Vevay in Switzerland County

agency_desc: A public library that provides access to fiction and non-fiction library materials to patrons of all ages.
service_description: The public library has boosted their WiFi to extend service to parking lots. WiFi is only available during library hours.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A county program that offers programs including fitness, youth leadership, volunteerism, and community outreach in the Switzerland county area.
service_description: Offers programs for all ages, including all-season sports, weight-lifting, aerobics, and swimming lessons/water aerobics. Members pay dues for open access to the fitness center, fitness classes, and pool, and receive discounted rates for special programs. Nonmembers pay fixed fees for classes.
site_details: Walk in or visit the website to join or register for specific programs. Call for more information.
site_eligibility: Open; membership not required for most programs, but members do receive discounts on fees.

agency_desc: Coordinates emergency management programs and response measures in Switzerland County.
service_description: Responds during a disaster or large-scale emergency in Switzerland County, assists with the recovery efforts afterwards, and takes steps to prevent or lessen the effects of future disasters. (Offers sandbags to Switzerland County households during times of flooding.)
site_details: Call for information. For emergency assistance, call 9-1-1.

site_schedule.name: County Offices of Emergency Services
site_schedule.schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-3pm -- After-hours Emergencies: On call, daily 24 hours

site_schedule.name: Disaster Relief/Recovery Organizations
site_schedule.schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-3pm -- After-hours Emergencies: On call, daily 24 hours

site_schedule.name: Emergency Preparedness and Response Planning
site_schedule.schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-3pm -- After-hours Emergencies: On call, daily 24 hours

site_schedule.name: General Disaster Information
site_schedule.schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-3pm -- After-hours Emergencies: On call, daily 24 hours

site_eligibility: Open; serves Switzerland County

agency_desc: County government department for building inspection and planning and zoning for Switzerland County.
service_description: Performing building inspection for construction, providing information and enforcing regulations on planning/zoning codes in Switzerland County.
nameLevel3: Land Use Planning and Regulation Services
site_details: Call for more information.
site_eligibility: Living in Switzerland County

agency_desc: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools within the district.
service_description: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools in this school district. Provides student transportation services and maintains information on school locations, enrollment, fees, and curricula. District provides information regarding special education services for students age 3-22 with disabilities.
site_details: Call for information about school assignment, transportation, or other issues. -- Contact the assigned school to enroll.
site_eligibility: Students living within the school district in grades K-12

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities; administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration; issues marriage licenses; and records state tax liens in Switzerland County.
service_description: Processes court-ordered child support payments in the county and provides records of payment history. Payer and payee must keep their names and addresses current with this office; any changes must be made in writing.
taxonomy_name: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices
nameLevel4: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices
site_details: Payment history print out: Walk in to obtain. -- Update name/address: Walk in or mail changes. -- Payment Information: Visit website or call the Indiana Kids Line.

site_schedule.name: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices

site_eligibility: Parents ordered by the court to pay or receive child support

Marriage license: Both parties at least age 18 (call or visit website for exceptions) -- At least one applicant from this county -OR- both from out of state -- Certified copies: License must have been issued in this county
Varies by service; serves Switzerland County
Registering to vote: United States citizen -- Age 18 by the day of the next election -- Not currently incarcerated -- To vote: Registered to vote a minimum of 29 days before the election

agency_desc: Serves as the executive and administrative authority.
service_description: Serves as the executive and administrative authority fortheir respectivecounty, including performing the following duties:controls, maintains, and supervises county property; audits and authorizes claims against the county; receives bids for and authorizes county contracts; performs certain election functions; handles appeal of township trustee decisions.
site_details: Call for assistance.

site_schedule.name: General Relief Appeals/Complaints
site_schedule.schedule: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Board Meetings: Monthly 1st and 3rd Mon 5pm

site_schedule.name: Local Officials Offices
site_schedule.schedule: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Board Meetings: Monthly 1st and 3rd Mon 5pm

site_eligibility: Varies by service

agency_desc: Represents the state of Indiana in felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions, conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic violations, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
service_description: Files, modifies, and enforces court-ordered child support cases in Switzerland County.
site_details: To apply for child support or request child support enforcement or modification, walk in to pick up an application or call the prosecutor's office for information. -- For payment information, call the Indiana Kids Line.
site_eligibility: To File for Child Support Assistance: Living in Switzerland County -- Parent, guardian, aunt, uncle, or grandparent who has physical custody of a child (ages 0-18) -- Requiring financial support from a noncustodial parent of the child
Varies by service
Victims and witnesses of major crimes in Switzerland County

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Provides probation services for the Switzerland County Circuit Court, including supervising juvenile and adult offenders in the community and linking them with programs and services to support their rehabilitation.
site_details: Call for more information
site_eligibility: Offenders assigned to probation by the Switzerland County Courts
Persons named in cases or called for jury duty at this court

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Maintains records of all births and deaths that occur in the County and provides certified copies of birth and death certificates for fixed fees.
site_details: Walk in, download application from website, or call to have application sent by mail. -- Bring or mail in completed application, required documentation, and payment. -- Indiana birth certificates and death records may also be requested online at www.vitalchek.com; this service is offered by a third-party and is not directly affiliated with the health department.
site_eligibility: Births/deaths occurring in the County -- Individual named on the birth certificate, parent, or other adult with a legal right to the certificate
Schools, community organizations, and other groups
Varies by service; serves Switzerland County

Age 2 months through 18 years-old -- Without health insurance -OR- insurance does not cover needed vaccine (including coverage that has capped out) -OR- insured through Medicaid -OR- American Indian or Alaskan Native, regardless of insurance status
Varies by service; call for information.
Living within the county
Age 6 months or older
Age 19 or older

Testing is recommended for any child 6 months through 6 years-old who: Lives in or visits a building constructed before 1978 -Or- lives with someone who works with lead (such as a battery factory, steel smelter, stained glass) -OR- has a sibling or playmate who has been diagnosed with lead poisoning.
